definition[0]: to increase and become four times as big or as high, or to make something increase in this way
example[0]: Food prices quadrupled during the war.
example[1]: The company has quadrupled its profits in just three years.
definition[1]: four times as big or as many
example[2]: The subjects were given quadruple the normal dosage of the drug.
definition[2]: involving four things of the same kind
definition[3]: to increase or make something increase by four times
example[4]: Pre-tax profits have more than quadrupled from £5 million to over £20 million.
example[5]: OPEC quadrupled the price of oil.
example[6]: We hope to quadruple production in two years.
